alert.note: Alert for Eastern Cherry; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 3:41PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cherry County through 500 PM CDT... At 341 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles west of Merritt Reservoir, or 36 miles southwest of Valentine, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Merritt Reservoir, Schoolhouse Lake, Steer Creek Campground and Anderson Bridge State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 177 and 178. Highway 97 between mile markers 93 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
